Summary Madhusudan Madinur is a technically competent and reliable team member with over 15 years of professional experience in semiconductor and telecommunications industry. He is a seasoned professional with hands on work experience that includes product development, implementation, integration, debugging and verification of digital signal processing/embedded software and firmware with emphasis on audio/speech quality enhancement, RF, physical layer modem components and speech/audio coders for wired home and wireless handheld devices. Well versed in speech/audio quality analysis, tuning and testing of cell phones utilizing state-of-the-art lab equipment and testing protocols. In addition, also has experience implementing and debugging drivers to control the audio and modem hardware blocks and abstraction layer software to interface with multiple processors. 
 
He has held engineering positions at Broadcom, MIPs, Atmel, Venture Design Svcs and Infineon Technologies and he has a bachelors degree in Electronics and Communications Engineering from Karnatak University, Dharwad India. 
 
Specialties:  
•Strong competency in digital signal processing and embedded software, firmware and driver development.  
•DSP based speech/audio compression and processing (multi-rate filter banks, time/frequency domain AECs, single/multi-mic noise reduction, DRC etc..) . 
•Working experience and understanding of GSM, GPRS, EDGE, UMTS and LTE technologies. 
•Proven track record of implementing and optimizing the DSP software and firmware for various DSP and RISC processors with MCPS and memory constraints. 
•Involved in complete product life cycle and have thorough understanding of software development methodology.  
•Involved in pre-silicon and post-silicon validation. 
•Experienced in Agile and Scrum methodologies.
